panels.description: The European Galaxy server is built on the shoulders of our European ELIXIR partners. This map is providing you some impression of how many jobs are currently processed by external clouds across Europe. Each of the circles represents one ELIXIR partner that provides compute resources via a locally hosted pulsar server. The European Galaxy server is then submitting jobs to these pulsar servers and collects the inputs as soon as finished. If one of the sites is down Galaxy will attempt to resubmit the job to some other resources.

targets.query: SELECT last("count") FROM "queue-overview" WHERE ("job_runner_name" =~ /^pulsar_.*/ AND "job_runner_name" != 'condor')  AND ("state" = 'queued' OR "state" = 'running')  GROUP BY time(10m), "job_runner_name" fill(none)

panels.title: Jobs processing across Europe

panels.description: Users that used the [ELIXIR AAI](https://elixir-europe.org/services/compute/aai) (Authentication and Authorisation Infrastructure) to log into the European Galaxy server.
panels.title: Galaxy Elixir AAI Users

options.content: This information is calculated from the assigned `galaxy_slots` multiplied by `runtime_seconds` for each job. It will not calculate the exact CPU usage but it gives and approximation for what was allocated on our infrastructure, across multiple clouds.

panels.content: These graphs are currently experiencing some issues, and we need to re-load the data.
panels.title: Panel Title
